intro: Halenia longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed halenia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with four petals. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Halenia longicaulis is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands.
